abstract: Federal officials plan to overhaul the rules that regulate medical research involving human subjects in effort to protect privacy; critics, including many humanities and social sciences organizations, warn that the revisions could seal off vast collections of publicly available information from inspection.
snippet: As federal officials plan to overhaul the rules that regulate research involving human subjects, critics warn that the revisions could seal off publicly available information.
lead_paragraph: As federal officials plan to overhaul the rules that regulate research involving human subjects, critics warn that the revisions could seal off publicly available information.

headline.seo: Rules Meant to Protect Human Research Subjects Cause Concern
